content: nice shoulder shaping that will make the shawl stay put without excess material in the neck see either pattern or the chart faroese kevät shawl v 2 1 february 2015 © makoshark 2012 page 4 the body after about 4 inches you should have enough shoulder width now you can combine the outer segments on each side leaving the gusset markers for another inch or so before dissolving the gusset separation too from that point onward you will just have the selvage markers and in between one segment with the allover leaf-pattern i leave the selvage markers in until i knit the last four or six row or garter stitch as border you can now knit this pattern until you run out of time yarn or patience  and then start the 4 or 5 ridges garter stitch or crochet a nice border at the lower rim you also could plan ahead and make garter triangles before you go over to the all-garter border beginning at the last yo m1 yo row you could knit the opening leaves where are no decreases on the even row so that they form garter triangles and when you reach the point where the closing leaves are reduced to 1 stitch you just start with the garter stitch row of the bottom border now you just have to weave in ends wash and perhaps block this shawl and then wear it  makoshark faroese kevät shawl v 2 1 february 2015 © makoshark 2012 page 5 pattern faroese kevät shawl row 1 k1tbl k4 slm *k3 -slm repeat from * 5 times end with 5 selvage stitches k4 yfw sl1pw row 2 and all even row k1tbl k4 slm purl stitches until you come to the selvage stitches k4 yfw sl1pw row 3 k1tbl k4 slm * yo k3 yo -
